title: Re: test
content:
Well you could at least fix the grammar in your signature first [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

Edit: Well I would've thought it was obvious...

[quote]Quote:[hr]You gotta be a bit more specific then that[hr][/quote]"then" means "do something after this" as in "load Keen, then start a new game", "than" is when you're referring to something else, as is this case - You gotta be a bit more specific than that

[quote]Quote:[hr]Tough Guys Can Fix There Own Problems!!![hr][/quote]"there" refers to a location, you can almost always replace it with "over there" and the sentence will still make sense - in this case "Tough guys can fix over there own problems" doesn't make sense, so you've used the wrong 'there' - in this case the problems belong to the 'tough guys', so you use 'their', which shows ownership.

title: Re: New Testing topic 2 [If you have a test to make, CLICK H
content:
New signature - now 100% hidden link free! (This will make Gal and LL happier, I hope.) On an unrelated side note, I have discovered that you can inject CSS into ezBoard posts and sigs using the face attribute of the font ezCode - if you disable emoticons. Yay!BOOYAH SAYS I, FOR I HAVE CRACKED THE HIDDEN EZBOARD CSS CODE!! MUAHAHAHA...

(Please don't kill me admins. Thankyou.)

title: Re: [font face=wh00p wh00p wh00p]
content:
Ah.. That is pretty clever Grafix! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] I see how it works.. Nice find.. I think you should report them (if you haven't done that already).. It'd be really annoying if people started to use that kind of floating things made with CSS in their posts or sigs.

Edit: LL, it seems their parser doesn't remove the CSS span class things made by user, thus allowing this kind of things. Technically one could make it so that the whole screen is filled alone by one's signature or post, if one wanted to be fucling annoying. The ezBoard seems to use span class stuff theirselves a lot.

Amazing that this hasn't been discovered before. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-stunned.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
